result.execSummary:
The defendant Charis C.A. Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:23 PM 
Defendant Charis C.A. Turner in court.  Attorney Robert S. Duxstad in court for Charis C.A. Turner.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Duxstad   Informs the court this matter is resolved and files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the court.
Defendant enters plea of "NO CONTEST" .
Court questions defendant re: her plea and waiver of rights.
Parties stipulate to a factual basis.
Court questions attorney Duxstad re: his clients plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY". 

State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney Duxstad joins in the motion.

Court Orders: $100.00 Fine + Costs
